GBSeq.GBSeq_definition: Bovine viral diarrhea virus 1, complete genome
GBSeq.GBSeq_taxonomy: Viruses; ssRNA viruses; ssRNA positive-strand viruses, no DNA stage; Flaviviridae; Pestivirus

GBReference.GBReference_title: Molecular cloning and nucleotide sequence of the pestivirus bovine viral diarrhea virus

GBReference.GBReference_journal: Submitted (01-AUG-2000) National Center for Biotechnology Information, NIH, Bethesda, MD 20894, USA

GBSeq.GBSeq_comment: VALIDATED REFSEQ: This record has undergone validation or preliminary review. The reference sequence was derived from M31182.; COMPLETENESS: full length.

GBQualifier.GBQualifier_value: The mature peptides and accompanying comments have been added to the annotation by the NCBI staff based on the publications 1 through 6
cleaves itself from the nascent polyprotein; N-terminal proteinase
the C-terminus is cleaved from the polyprotein by a cellular signal peptidase; structural protein C
the N-terminus is cleaved from the polyprotein by a cellular signal peptidase; structural protein E-rns
exists as E1-E2 heterodimer; the C-terminus is cleaved from the polyprotein by a cellular signal peptidase; structural protein E1

non-essential protein; the C-terminal border of this protein was not experimentally determined; the N-terminus and probably C-terminus of this protein are cleaved from the polyprotein by cellular peptidase(s); E2p7
exists in the form of homodimer; this protein is cleaved from the polyprotein by a cellular signal peptidase; structural protein E2
the N-terminus and probably C-terminus of this protein are cleaved from the polyprotein by cellular peptidase(s); putative virion maturation protein
the N-terminus is cleaved from the polyprotein by a cellular peptidase; the C-terminus is cleaved by the NS3 proteinase domain; nonstructural protein NS2-3; serine proteinase (NS3)

characteristic of cytopathogenic strains. This protein is produced from NS2-3 as a result of various recombination events involving cellular sequences (e.g. ubiquitin) or a few point mutations in the strain Oregon. The cleavage of BVDV NCP7 (non-pathogenic strain) NS2-3 was promoted by the interaction of NS2 (suspected to be a non-canonical proteinase) with cellular J-domain protein Jiv (whose sequence fragment was identified in pathogenic BVDV NADL); nonstructural protein NS3; serine proteinase
NS2-3/NS3 proteinase cofactor; is cleaved from the polyprotein by NS2-3/NS3 proteinase; phosphoprotein
is cleaved from the polyprotein by NS2-3/NS3 proteinase
is cleaved from the polyprotein by NS2-3/NS3 proteinase with the help of NS4A; phosphoprotein; probably involved in RNA relication
is cleaved from the polyprotein by NS2-3/NS3 proteinase with the help of NS4A; nonstructural protein NS5B
